p: The essential oils obtained from wild-growing H. officinalis L. subsp. aristatus in Bulgaria in two stages of development (during the flower bud formation and in the full bloom) were similar in composition, with 1,8-cineole (48.2% and 39.6%), isopinocamphone (16.3% and 29.2%) and β-pinene (11.4% and 39.6%) as the major constituents. The essential oil obtained from cultivated H. officinalis contained larger amounts of isopinocamphone (40.2%), pinocamphone (10.3%) and β-pinene (14.2%), but no traces of 1,8-cineole [ 22].
